courses.name: Introduction to Soils
courses.description: (same as PLNT_S 2100). Introduction to soil sciences with emphasis placed on physical, biological, and chemical properties and application to land use, plant growth and environmental problems.

courses.name: Soil Science Laboratory
courses.description: Laboratory application of fundamental soil science concepts.

courses.name: Topics in Soil Science
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics in soil science.

courses.name: Problems in Soil Science
courses.description: Special individualized research projects or readings in soil science.

courses.name: Soils and the Environment
courses.description: (same as ENV_SC 3290). Addresses the role of soils and soil properties on environmental pollution and management. Emphasis will be placed on carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus, and sulfur transformations and transport in natural and disturbed ecosystems and soil management practices and technology to prevent or remediate environmental pollution.

courses.name: Soils and the Environment - Writing Intensive
courses.description: (same as ENV_SC 3290). Addresses the role of soils and soil properties on environmental pollution and management. Emphasis will be placed on carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus, and sulfur transformations and transport in natural and disturbed ecosystems and soil management practices and technology to prevent or remediate environmental pollution.

courses.name: Topics in Soil Science
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics in soil science.

courses.name: Problems in Soil Science
courses.description: Special individualized non-thesis research projects or readings in soil science.

courses.name: Environmental Soil Physics
courses.description: (same as ENV_SC 4305). Study of soil physical properties and processes important in solving environmental problems. Topics include soil solids, water content and energy, and transport of water, solutes, gas and heat.

courses.name: Environmental Soil Physics Laboratory
courses.description: (same as ENV_SC 4306). Introduction to the methodology and equipment for measurement of soil physical properties and processes.

courses.name: Soil Conservation
courses.description: Conservation of soil with respect to topsoil, soil productivity, and fertility.

courses.name: Environmental Soil Microbiology
courses.description: (same as ENV_SC 4312). Microbiology/ecology of life in the soil ecosystem. Emphasis is placed on the role of microbes in nutrient cycling, microbial pesticide/xenobiotic transformation bioremediation, etc.

courses.name: Soil Fertility and Plant Nutrition
courses.description: (same as PLNT_S 4313). Explanation of principles of delivery of plant nutrients to plants, discussion of the role of each essential nutrient in crop plants and introduction to the management of soil amendments.

courses.name: Soil Fertility and Plant Nutrition Laboratory
courses.description: (same as PLNT_S 4314). The application of elementary analytical procedures to the evaluation of the nutrient status of soils and crop plants.

courses.name: Environmental Soil Chemistry
courses.description: (same as ENV_SC 4318 and GEOL 4318). Study of chemical constituents and processes occurring in soils.  Topics include soil minerals, and weathering processes, organic matter, solution chemistry, oxidation-reduction reactions and adsorption processes.
courses.prerequisites: SOIL 2100 or GEOL 2400, CHEM 1320 and CHEM 1330; junior standing or  instructor's consent

courses.name: Genesis of Soil Landscapes
courses.description: The co-evolution of soil landscapes. The role of water in the accumulation of parent materials and development of soil horizons. Factors and processes of soil genesis. Distribution of soil in their natural settings.
courses.recommendation: introductory soil science or introductory geology course

courses.name: Precision Agriculture Science and Technology
courses.description: (same as AG_S_M 4360, PLNT_S 4360; cross-leveled with SOIL 7360, AG_S_M 7360, PLNT_S 7360). Precision agriculture is an information-based approach to farming whereby variability is managed to optimize crop production and reduce environmental pollution. This course provides an overview of precision agriculture technologies (like GIS, GPS, remote sensing), mapping methods, and case studies illustrating decisions and management.
courses.prerequisites: PLNT_S 2100 or SOIL 2100, or PLNT_S 2110, or instructor's consent

courses.name: Soil Science Internship
courses.description: Supervised professional experience with an approved public or private organization. Course may be repeated for credit.  Graded on S/U basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Soil and Atmospheric Sciences majors only, instructor's consent

courses.name: Undergraduate Research in Soil Science
courses.description: Research apprenticeship with a faculty mentor. Students are expected to develop initial concept for the research, design experiments, collect data, and analyze data with faculty input, oversight, and guidance.
courses.prerequisites: SOIL 2100 and SOIL 2106, STAT 2530, or instructor's consent
courses.recommendation: 9 hours of Soil Science with at least 3 hours above the 3000-level

courses.name: Topics in Soil Science
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics in soil science. Intended for graduate students.

courses.name: Problems in Soil Science
courses.description: Special individualized non-thesis research projects or readings in soil science.

courses.name: Environmental Soil Physics
courses.description: (same as ENV_SC 7305). Study of soil physical properties and processes important in solving environmental problems. Topics include soil solids, water content and energy, and transport of water, solutes, gas and heat.

courses.name: Environmental Soil Physics Laboratory
courses.description: (same as ENV_SC 7306).  Introduction to the methodology and equipment for measurement of soil physical properties and properties and processes.

courses.name: Soil Conservation
courses.description: Conservation of soil with respect to topsoil, soil productivity, and fertility.

courses.name: Environmental Soil Microbiology
courses.description: (same as ENV_SC 7312). Microbiology/ecology of life in the soil ecosystem. Emphasis is placed on the role of microbes in nutrient cycling, microbial pesticide/xenobiotic transformations bioremediation, etc.
courses.prerequisites: general microbiology, SOIL 2100, or instructor's consent

courses.name: Soil Fertility and Plant Nutrition
courses.description: (same as PLNT_S 7313). Explanation of principles of delivery of plant nutrients to plants, discussion of the role of each essential nutrient in crop plants and introduction to the management of soil amendments.

courses.name: Soil Fertility and Plant Nutrition Laboratory
courses.description: (same as PLNT_S 7314). The application of elementary analytical procedures to the evaluation of the nutrient status of soils and crop plants.

courses.name: Environmental Soil Chemistry
courses.description: (same as GEOL 7318 and ENV_SC 7318). Study of chemical constituents and processes occurring in soils.  Topics include soil minerals, and weathering processes, organic matter, solution chemistry, oxidation-reduction reactions and adsorption processes.
courses.prerequisites: SOIL 2100 or GEOL 2400,  CHEM 1320 and CHEM 1330; junior standing or instructor's consent

courses.name: Genesis of Soil Landscape
courses.description: The co-evolution of soil landscapes. The role of water in the accumulation of parent materials and development of soil horizons. Factors and processes of soil genesis. Distribution of soil in their natural settings.
courses.prerequisites: introductory soil science or introductory geology or permission of instructor

courses.name: Precision Agriculture Science and Technology
courses.description: (same as AG_S_M 7360 and PLNT_S 7360; cross-leveled with SOIL 4360, AG_S_M 4360, PLNT_S 7360). Precision agriculture is an information-based approach to farming whereby variability is managed to optimize crop production and reduce environmental pollution. This course provides an overview of precision agriculture technologies (like GIS, GPS, remote sensing), mapping methods, and case studies illustrating decisions and management.

courses.name: Topics in Soil Science
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics in soil science. Intended for graduate students.

courses.name: Problems in Soil Science
courses.description: Special individualized non-thesis research projects or readings in soil science.

courses.name: Masters Research in Soil Science
courses.description: Original investigations in soil science for presentation in a thesis.  Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Solute Transport in the Vadose Zone
courses.description: (same as ENV_SC 8400). Transport of water and solutes in geomedia with emphasis on development of the equations of flow.  Evaluation of analytical and numeral solutions to equations describing transport phenomena.

courses.name: Nonthesis Research in Soil Science
courses.description: Research not expected to terminate in dissertation.

courses.name: Chemistry of the Vadose Zone
courses.description: (same as ENV_SC 8500). Chemical reactions occurring in geomedia with emphasis on understanding molecular scale processes occurring at the solid-water interface, aqueous geochemistry, and soil organic matter.
courses.prerequisites: SOIL 7318 or GEOL 7300 or instructor's consent

courses.name: Topics in Soil Science
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics in soil science. Intended for graduate students.

courses.name: Problems in Soil Science
courses.description: Special individualized non-thesis research projects or readings in soil science.

courses.name: Seminar in Soil Science
courses.description: In-depth development of advanced aspects of soil science through reviews of results of research in progress and current scientific publications.

courses.name: Doctoral Research in Soil Science
courses.description: Original investigations in soil science for presentation in a dissertation.  Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Advanced Environmental Soil Physics
courses.description: (same as ENV_SC 9407).  Transport of mass and energy through soil with emphasis on development of the equations of flow. Evaluation of analytical and numerical solutions to differential equations describing transport phenomena.
courses.prerequisites: SOIL 7305, MATH 4100 or MATH 7100, or equivalent

courses.name: Advanced Soil Fertility
courses.description: History and application of concepts of fertility and plant nutrition.
courses.prerequisites: SOIL 7313 and PLNT_S 7315 or equivalent, 14 hours of college chemistry and five hours of calculus

courses.name: Advanced Environmental Soil Chemistry
courses.description: (same as ENV_SC 9418). Linking molecular-scale solution-phase and surface reactions with macroscopic chemical processes.  Fundamentals of aqueous surface and colloid chemistry will be discussed.

courses.name: Pedology
courses.description: Three one-hour lectures. Detailed study of processes of soil horizonization and current topics in soil genesis including quantitative assessment of spatial and temporal variability and application of GIS in landuse planning.
courses.prerequisites: SOIL 7320, one statistics course beyond ANOVA
